questions.question: What does the driver/narrator do to show that he is sane?

choices.answer: States facts about himself
Tells the story of the hitchhiker
Discusses Mother’s concerns
Admits that his life might end soon

questions.question: Which event foreshadows the appearance of the hitchhiker?

choices.answer: The man at the gas station fills up Adams’s car.
Mother tells Adams not to pick up strangers.
An operator asks Adams to deposit money.
Adams tells Mother that he will be careful.

questions.question: Which clue does the author give the listener about hitchhiker that builds suspense?

choices.answer: The author describes the "fresh rain on his shoulders."
The hitchhiker never speaks.
The hitchhiker is dressed in a "strange way."
Hitchhikers are unusual on the Pennsylvania turnpike.

questions.question: What direction is the hitchhiker heading?

choices.answer: North
South
East
West

questions.question: Where does the hitchhiker say he is going?

choices.answer: Ohio
New York
California
New Mexico

questions.question: How fast was the driver traveling?

choices.answer: 55 MPH
59 MPH
60 MPH
85 MPH

questions.question: What did he learn when he used the payphone in the auto camp?

choices.answer: He learns that his mother died.
His mother is in a coma.
He died in an automobile accident.
Mrs. Whitney is the driver.

questions.question: What does Adams come to believe while he is stuck on the train tracks?

choices.answer: He is merely imagining the hitchhiker.
The hitchhiker is leading him to death
He is lonely and must pick up the hitchhiker.
His mother is gravely ill and needs his help
The author is writing about a memory that he has had
The author is going back in time
The author gives you a hint of future action in the story
The author is speaking in 1st person point of view

questions.question: At the end of the radio play, Adams realizes that six days earlier he

choices.answer: Lost his mother to a fatal disease
Killed the hitchhiker on the train tracks
Died in an automobile accident in Brooklyn
Went insane and abandoned his responsibilities

questions.question: How would the character of the hitchhiker be characterized?

choices.answer: Round/Dynamic
Static/Dynamic
Static/Flat
Static/Round

questions.question: How does the author build suspense in the plot of "The Hitchhiker?"

choices.answer: Through characterization, setting, theme.
By characterization, sounds, sensory details, & conflict.
Through setting, sensory details, and repetition.
Repetition of characters' actions, descriptions & thoughts
An attraction to someone
An emphasis on actual events
A belief in an unpopular idea
A guarantee of something

questions.question: How does the author help the audience experience tension?

choices.answer: Through the characters' external conflicts.
Through the author's use of foreshadowing and similes.
Through repetition to foreshadow the hitchhiker's appearance
Through the use of inner conflict.

questions.question: How does the author drive the plot?

choices.answer: Through the symbolism of the hitchhiker.
Through the protagonist's descriptions of the hitchhiker.
Through the diction and tone of the writing.
Through the protagonist's conflicts with death.
